title: A better alternative to force pushing
partialText: Forced pushes in shared branches are dangerous, but did you know there's a safer alternative?

title: List all Git aliases
partialText: Did you set up a lot of Git aliases and forgot what they are? List them all with this command.

title: Customize Git using aliases for common operations
partialText: Increase your productivity and reduce your cognitive load by creating aliases for many common git operations.

title: Explicit code is always better
partialText: A thesis on why magic abstractions are harmful to codebases and teams.

title: What I learned from vibe coding a small web project with GitHub Copilot and GPT-5 mini
partialText: A short summary of your story up to 140 characters long.

title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock JavaScript Solution
partialText: Have you tried solving "Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock" on LeetCode? Let's take a couple of approaches to tackle it in JavaScript.

title: How your tech stack is causing your refactoring problems
partialText: Infinite flexibility in your tech stack can lead to refactoring headaches and technical debt. Here's how to avoid the trap.

title: A first look at the Speculation Rules API
partialText: The new Speculation Rules API aims to deliver across the board performance optimizations with little developer effort. Let's see how!

title: The virtues of pair programming
partialText: Pair programming can be valuable for junior and senior developers alike, fostering collaboration and knowledge sharing.

title: How to secure your JavaScript code from vulnerable dependencies
partialText: Keep your code, data, and users safe by following these simple tips to secure your JavaScript projects from vulnerable dependencies.

title: How do I fix incorrect line endings in a git repository?
partialText: Have you ever encountered an issue with incorrect line endings in your git repository? Let's fix it!

title: The art of writing great code
partialText: Writing great code is more than writing code that works, requiring discipline and a focus on testability, maintainability, and readability.

title: Meditation and the art of debugging
partialText: What's the connection between meditation and debugging? Let's find out.

title: Solving Sudoku with wave function collapse in JavaScript
partialText: Explore how to solve Sudoku puzzles in JavaScript using the wave function collapse algorithm, a constraint-propagation technique.

title: No code is inherently evil
partialText: No code tools? No code at all? No code you write? Prepare for a triple entendre that cuts deep into the world of software development.

title: The frontend trap
partialText: How staying on the frontend can limit your career growth and a hot take on how to escape it.

title: How does JavaScript's structuredClone() differ from other cloning methods?
partialText: Learn how to deep clone objects in JavaScript using structuredClone, and how it compares to other cloning methods.

title: How can I find the minimum height tree in an undirected tree in JavaScript?
partialText: Using the degree of nodes, we can employ a very efficient algorithmic trick to find the minimum height tree in an undirected tree in JavaScript.

title: How can I find the diameter of an undirected tree in JavaScript?
partialText: Using a two-pass DFS approach, we can efficiently find the diameter of an undirected tree in JavaScript.

title: How can I apply bipartite coloring to an undirected tree in JavaScript?
partialText: Learn how to apply bipartite coloring to an undirected tree in JavaScript, ensuring that no two adjacent nodes share the same color.

title: How can I traverse an undirected tree using DFS or BFS in JavaScript?
partialText: Learn how to traverse an undirected tree using Depth-First Search (DFS) or Breadth-First Search (BFS) in JavaScript.

title: How can I build an undirected tree from an array of edges in JavaScript?
partialText: Learn how to build an undirected tree from an array of edges in JavaScript, with various approaches for storing node relationships.

title: Convert between binary and decimal numbers in JavaScript
partialText: Binary numbers are a fundamental part of computer science. Learn how to convert between binary and decimal numbers in JavaScript.

title: How 30 seconds of code is deployed
partialText: A historical run-through of how 30 seconds of code was deployed then and now.

title: Exploring indexes and cardinality with JavaScript
partialText: Using indexes can speed up querying object collections significantly, but it seems like a black box for many. Let's dive in!

partialText: While a brute-force longest palindrome finder is simple, it is not efficient. Let's explore a more efficient solution.

title: Using binary search to find the index to insert a number in a sorted JavaScript array
partialText: Combining techniques presented in the past, we can solve a more complex problem with stellar performance.

title: Digitize a number in JavaScript
partialText: Learn how to convert any number to an array of digits, as well as how to sum the digits and compute the digital root efficiently.

title: Design systems rarely survive contact with the real world
partialText: Design systems are often seen as the holy grail of design and development, but there are a few issues that can arise in the real world.

title: Implementing a Sudoku validator in JavaScript
partialText: Sudoku is a logic-based combinatorial number-placement puzzle. This article discusses how to implement a Sudoku validator in JavaScript.

title: Markdown Cheatsheet
partialText: Markdown is the most popular markup language for writing documentation. Here is a cheatsheet with the most common syntax.

title: Vocal fails are better than silent fails
partialText: Learn why vocal errors are better than silent ones, how to handle them effectively, and improve debugging and collaboration in JavaScript.

partialText: After working with 2D arrays for a while, I decided to create a convenient wrapper for operations. Here's the gist of it.

partialText: Instead of reconfiguring ESLint and Prettier every time, I use this configuration to get started quickly.

partialText: Leverage modern HTML and CSS capabilities to create a tabbed content component without JavaScript.

partialText: Did you know you don't need JavaScript to create accordion-style content? Here's how to do it with the details element.

title: Are text-align and align-items the same when it comes to text alignment in CSS?
partialText: In the age of flexbox and grid, text alignment may seem simpler than ever, but there are a few things you should be aware of.

partialText: The inset shorthand property makes element positioning in CSS easier. Learn how to use it effectively in your projects.

partialText: New to CSS logical properties? This article provides a handy map of logical properties to their physical counterparts.

title: You Shouldn't Always Modularize Your Code
partialText: Have you ever stopped to wonder if modularization is right for your use case? What if I told you it might not be?

title: Progressive enhancement with Web Components
partialText: Dive into Web Components with me and learn how I used them to create modular interactive components to progressively enhance my website.

title: Implementing fuzzy matching in JavaScript
partialText: Having built a search engine with TF-IDF and inverted indexes, we will now implement fuzzy matching to make searching error-tolerant.

title: Formatting relative time in JavaScript
partialText: Did you know JavaScript has a built-in way to format relative time? It's called Intl.RelativeTimeFormat and it's awesome!

partialText: Learn how to easily detect the user's operating system in the browser using JavaScript.

title: Implementing partial search matching in JavaScript
partialText: Building on top of the TF-IDF and inverted index implementation, we will implement partial search matching to make searching more robust.

title: Implementing search in JavaScript, using TF-IDF and an inverted index
partialText: Building on top of the Porter stemmer, we'll explore how to use TF-IDF and an inverted index to implement a search algorithm in JavaScript.

title: Implementing the Porter stemming algorithm in JavaScript
partialText: Learn how to implement the Porter stemming algorithm in JavaScript, a simple algorithm for stripping English words of common suffixes.

title: Implementing signals and reactivity with vanilla JavaScript
partialText: Let's demystify signals and reactivity, one of the most popular patterns in modern JavaScript, using event-driven programming!

title: Using Test-Driven Development to refactor a JavaScript project
partialText: In the last installment of the series, we'll refactor our codebase to reduce bundle size and complexity, while making it more maintainable.
